intro: Calotis ancyrocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a velvety texture. Calotis ancyrocarpa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
